# Citation

## If you use RetroVibez or figures generated by it, please cite:

### Original Analysis Methods

This pipeline implements reversal detection methods from:

> Klein M, Afonso B, Vonner AJ, Hernandez-Nunez L, Berck M, Taber CJ, Cardona A, Zlatic M, Samuel ADT. (2015). Sensory determinants of behavioral dynamics in *Drosophila* thermotaxis. *Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences*, 112(2), E220-E229. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1416212112

**BibTeX:**
```bibtex
@article{klein2015sensory,
  title={Sensory determinants of behavioral dynamics in Drosophila thermotaxis},
  author={Klein, Mason and Afonso, Bruno and Vonner, Anggie J and Hernandez-Nunez, Luis and Berck, Matthew and Taber, Christopher J and Cardona, Albert and Zlatic, Marta and Samuel, Aravinthan DT},
  journal={Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences},
  volume={112},
  number={2},
  pages={E220--E229},
  year={2015},
  doi={10.1073/pnas.1416212112},
  publisher={National Academy of Sciences}
}
```

### Raw Data

Original behavioral data available at:
> Harvard Dataverse: https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/9JWPN2

### This Pipeline

If you use RetroVibez specifically:

> Raitses, G. (2025). RetroVibez: Larval Reversal Detection Pipeline. Mirna Lab, BioInspired Institute, Syracuse University. https://github.com/SkanataLab/retrovibez

**BibTeX:**
```bibtex
@software{raitses2025retrovibez,
  author = {Raitses, Gil},
  title = {RetroVibez: Larval Reversal Detection Pipeline},
  year = {2025},
  month = {December},
  institution = {Mirna Lab (Mirna Mihovilovic-Skanata), BioInspired Institute, Syracuse University},
  url = {https://github.com/SkanataLab/retrovibez}
}
```

## Example Acknowledgment

When publishing figures generated with this tool:

> "Reversal detection analysis was performed using RetroVibez (Raitses, 2025), implementing the dot-product method described in Klein et al. (2015)."
